links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: Multiplicative with a(p^e) = p ^ min(e,3), p prime, e > 0. [_Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jan 06 2012]
example: a(96)=24 since the factors of 96 are {1,2,3,4,6,8,12,16,24,32,48,96} but 32, 48 and 96 all contain a 4th power factor (16).
prog: (Haskell)a058035 n = product $   zipWith (^) (a027748_row n) (map (min 3) $ a124010_row n)-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jan 06 2012
author: _Henry Bottomley_, Nov 16 2000
